page.title: 01OVER-VIEW
page.content: OUR BLOCK IS DIVIDED INTO TWO SHARPLY CONTRASTING AREAS. THE DIVIDING LINE BETWEEN THESE TWO AREAS RUNS DIAGONALLY THROUGH THE BLOCK FROM THE NORTH WEST TO THE SOUTH EAST AND IT COMPRISES THE DUAL CARRIAGEWAY ARTERIAL ROAD FROM LONDON TO SHOEBURYNESS. TO THE SOUTH OF THIS ROAD IS A MAINLY RESIDENTIAL AREA ORIGINALLY BUILT IN THE FIRST DECADES OF THIS CENTURY; THERE IS ALSO A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF LIGHT INDUSTRY MIXED IN AMONG THE HOUSES. TO THE NORTH OF THE ROAD IS A MAINLY ARABLE FARMING AREA WITH LIGHTLY SCATTERED HOUSING WHICH HAS REMAINED LARGELY UNCHANGED FOR CENTURIES. COMPARED WITH OTHER PARTS OF SOUTHEND THE BLOCK COVERS AN AREA PARTS OF WHICH ARE RATHER DEPRESSED ALTHOUGH THERE ARE SIGNS OF IMPROVEMENT AND INDUSTRIAL GROWTH.
